thread.title: Delaware State University Adds AI Gun Detection Technology
thread.title_full: Delaware State University Adds AI Gun Detection Technology

author: Facility Executive
title: Delaware State University Adds AI Gun Detection Technology
text:
Delaware State University, an HBCU (Historically Black Colleges and Universities) located in Dover, Delaware, recently integrated ZeroEyes’ AI gun detection technology and situational awareness platform into its multi-layered security system. The project was facilitated by Delaware-based Advantech.
Delaware State University (DSU) is a public university dedicated to providing quality education, research, and service. Established in 1891, DSU offers a diverse range of undergraduate and graduate programs and fostes academic excellence and community engagement.
“I’m always looking for the most innovative technology to assist us in preventing and solving crime, and maintaining a feeling of safety for our community,” said James Overton, superintendent at DSU. “I knew ZeroEyes’ gun detection technology was good, but the human element behind it, which minimizes false positive detections, convinced me that this was a serious product capable of mitigating false alarms and preventing harm.”
Advantech is a global leader in embedded and automation solutions for AIoT system integrators. The company has built a reputation in the education sector, serving both K-12 and higher education institutions…
